Class FL

    Static Collections and Stream utilities.
    Author:
    Fastily

        Returns:

      • toSAL

        public static ArrayList<String> toSAL(String... strings)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • mapListMerge

        public static <T1,T2> void mapListMerge(HashMap<String,HashMap<T1,T2>> hl,
                                        String k,
                                        HashMap<T1,T2> l)
        Puts or merges a HashMap into a HashMap pointed to by k. If k is present in hl, merge l with the list pointed to by k. If k is not present in hl, then add k to hl with value l. Does nothing if k is in hl and l is empty.
        Type Parameters:
        T1 - The first type in the HashMap to merge
        T2 - The second type in the HashMap to merge
        Parameters:
        hl - The HashMap to work with.
        k - The key to look for in hl.
        l - The list to put or merge if not found in hl with key k.

      • mapToList

        public static <T1,T2> ArrayList<Tuple<T1,T2>> mapToList(HashMap<T1,T2> h)
        Extracts each key-value pair from a HashMap and return the pairs as an ArrayList of Tuple objects.
        Type Parameters:
        T1 - The key type of the HashMap
        T2 - The value type of the HashMap
        Parameters:
        h - The HashMap to work with
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Tuples extracted from h.

      • flattenAL

        public static <T1> ArrayList<T1> flattenAL(ArrayList<ArrayList<T1>> l)
        Takes an ArrayList of ArrayList of type T1 and condenses them into one list.
        Type Parameters:
        T1 - The type contained in the inner ArrayLists
        Parameters:
        l - The ArrayList to squash
        Returns:
        The squashed ArrayList.

      • pMap

        public static HashMap<String,String> pMap(String... sl)
        Creates a HashMap with String keys and values. Pass in each pair and value (in that order) into sl. This will be one pair entered into resulting HashMap.
        Parameters:
        sl - The list of elements to turn into a HashMap.
        Returns:
        The resulting HashMap, or null if you specified an odd number of elements.
